basic.description:
The theory and use of numerical computational procedures to solve geo-engineering and geoscience problems. The utility, significance and widespread applicability of analytical and numerical techniques will be illustrated in the evaluation and solution of practical problems.
LEARNING HOURS    128 (36L;22T;6I;16Oc;48P)
basic.subject: GEOL
basic.title: Applications of Quantitative Analysis in Geological Sciences

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisites     GEOL249 and MATH232.
Corequisite     STAT263
Exclusion      No more than 3.0 units from GEOL349; GEOL359.
